body_html:
Hey @dimi-23 👋

Thanx a ton for reporting this 🙏

The problem originates from changes to the possible kinds of teams we recently introduced before this upcoming season (cc @ramonh ). In short: the old data of course does not adhere to the current datamodel 😉

The "fix" would be to simply run a migration on the production database. Therefore I'm not really sure if this issue is a good fit for you to work on 🤔 It's a) a bit boring and b) required access to several internal resources (e.g. the production database) which we - as you probably understand - cannot just give to you 😉

body:
Hey @dimi-23 👋 

Thanx a ton for reporting this 🙏 

The problem originates from changes to the possible `kinds` of teams we recently introduced before this upcoming season (cc @ramonh ). In short: the old data of course does not adhere to the current datamodel 😉 

The "fix" would be to simply run a migration on the production database. Therefore I'm not really sure if this issue is a good fit for you to work on 🤔 It's a) a bit boring and b) required access to several internal resources (e.g. the production database) which we - as you probably understand - cannot just give to you 😉
